DynamicsCompressorNode.summary: The DynamicsCompressorNode interface provides a compression effect, which lowers the volume of the loudest parts of the signal in order to help prevent clipping and distortion that can occur when multiple sounds are played and multiplexed together at once. This is often used in musical production and game audio. DynamicsCompressorNode is an that has exactly one input and one output.

DynamicsCompressorNodeAttack.summary: The attack property of the interface is a k-rate representing the amount of time, in seconds, required to reduce the gain by 10 dB. It defines how quickly the signal is adapted when its volume is increased.

remarks.para: The attack property's default value is 0.003 and it can be set between 0 and 1.

DynamicsCompressorNodeAttack.value:
An .
NOTEThough the returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

DynamicsCompressorNodeDynamicsCompressor.summary:
The DynamicsCompressorNode()
constructor creates a new object which provides
a compression effect, which lowers the volume of the loudest parts of the
signal, in order to help prevent clipping and distortion. That can occur when
multiple sounds are played and multiplexed together at once.

DynamicsCompressorNodeKnee.summary: The knee property of the interface is a k-rate containing a decibel value representing the range above the threshold where the curve smoothly transitions to the compressed portion.

remarks.para: The knee property's default value is 30 and it can be set between 0 and 40.

para.see: Describes the effect of a knee, showing two curves one for a hard knee, the other for a soft knee.

DynamicsCompressorNodeKnee.value:
An .
NOTEThough the returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

DynamicsCompressorNodeRatio.summary: The ratio property of the interface Is a k-rate representing the amount of change, in dB, needed in the input for a 1 dB change in the output.

remarks.para: The ratio property's default value is 12 and it can be set between 1 and 20.

para.see: Describes the effect of different ratio on the output signal

DynamicsCompressorNodeRatio.value:
An .
NOTEThough the returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

DynamicsCompressorNodeReduction.summary: The reduction read-only property of the interface is a float representing the amount of gain reduction currently applied by the compressor to the signal.

remarks.para: Intended for metering purposes, it returns a value in dB, or 0 (no gain reduction) if no signal is fed into the DynamicsCompressorNode. The range of this value is between -20 and 0 (in dB).

DynamicsCompressorNodeRelease.summary: The release property of the interface Is a k-rate representing the amount of time, in seconds, required to increase the gain by 10 dB. It defines how quick the signal is adapted when its volume is reduced.

remarks.para: The release property's default value is 0.25 and it can be set between 0 and 1.

DynamicsCompressorNodeRelease.value:
An .
NOTEThough the returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

DynamicsCompressorNodeThreshold.summary: The threshold property of the interface is a k-rate representing the decibel value above which the compression will start taking effect.

remarks.para: The threshold property's default value is -24 and it can be set between -100 and 0.

para.see: The threshold attribute has no effect on signals lowers than its value, but induce volume reduction on signal stronger than its value.

DynamicsCompressorNodeThreshold.value:
An .
NOTEThough the returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.
